snippet: President Robert Mugabe, 91, delivered a speech that he gave on Aug. 25, in which he pinned his hopes on China to help revive Zimbabwe’s economy.
abstract: Zimbabwean Pres Robert Mugabe redelivers August speech at Parliament’s September opening, prompting opposition Movement for Democratic Change party to question whether 91-year-old leader is unfit to lead; president’s spokesperson says speech repeat was due to mix-up at secretarial office.
lead_paragraph: President Robert Mugabe, 91, delivered a speech that he gave on Aug. 25, in which he pinned his hopes on China to help revive Zimbabwe’s economy.

headline.main: Zimbabwe: Mugabe Speech Turns Out to Be a Repeat
headline.print_headline: Africa; Zimbabwe: Mugabe Speech Turns Out to Be a Repeat
